Menristek Sebut RI Bisa Genjot Ekspor Buah Pakai Teknologi Nuklir
05 Nov 2019, 04:51 by Trio Hamdani


Menteri Riset dan Teknologi/Kepala Badan Riset dan Inovasi Nasional (Menristek/Kepala BRIN) Bambang Brodjonegoro/Foto: Grandyos Zafna

Jakarta - Teknologi nuklir di Indonesia belum dimaksimalkan karena adanya kekhawatiran radiasi. Padahal jika digunakan secara tepat, teknologi nuklir bisa memberi manfaat ekonomi.Menteri Riset dan Teknologi/Kepala Badan Riset dan Inovasi Nasional (Menristek/Kepala BRIN) Bambang Brodjonegoro bahkan mengatakan, pendekatan nuklir di sektor pangan bisa mendorong ekspor."Yang saya ingat produk buah kita kadang-kadang tidak bisa tembus ekspor ke suatu negara gara-gara lalat buah, gara-gara bakteri yang masih ada yang tidak bisa dihilangkan dengan teknologi biasa," kata dia di Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019)."Nah sekarang ada teknologi nuklir yang bisa membersihkan buah tersebut sehingga bisa diekspor. Ini lah salah satu contoh inovasi yang bisa langsung ber-impact kepada peningkatan ekspor," sambungnya.Inovasi tersebut, lanjut Bambang dikembangkan oleh Badan Tenaga Nuklir Nasional (Batan)."Kemarin saya dari Batan dikasih buah-buahan. Saya pikir buah-buahan biasa. Ternyata mereka menunjukkan buah-buahan yang sudah dibersihkan dari semua bakteri termasuk lalat buah sehingga buah itu bisa ready untuk ekspor," terangnya.Ia mengatakan penggunaan nuklir untuk pangan bisa membuat kualitas produk lebih baik lagi, sehingga produk tersebut bisa siap diekspor Indonesia."Jadi dengan pendekatan nuklir dia bisa membersihkan semua bakteri. Dan kenapa itu penting? untuk ekspor," tambahnya. Simak Video "Pertemukan Investor dan Pelaku Startup, Menristek Formulasikan RnD yang Tepat"[Gambas:Video 20detik](toy/ara)

The Minister of Research and Technology Call RI Can Boost Fruit Export Using Nuclear Technology
05 Nov 2019, 04:51 by Trio Hamdani


Minister of Research and Technology / Head of National Research and Innovation Agency (Menristek / Head of BRIN) Bambang Brodjonegoro / Photo: Grandyos Zafna

Jakarta - Nuclear technology in Indonesia has not yet been maximized due to radiation concerns. Even though if used appropriately, nuclear technology can provide economic benefits. Minister of Research and Technology / Head of the National Research and Innovation Agency (Menristek / Head of BRIN) Bambang Brodjonegoro even said that the nuclear approach in the food sector could boost exports. "What I remember is fruit products we sometimes can not penetrate exports to a country because of fruit flies, because of bacteria that still can not be removed with ordinary technology, "he said at the Kempinski Indonesia Hotel, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019) "Now there is nuclear technology that can clean the fruit so that it can be exported. This is one example of innovation that can directly have an impact on increasing exports," he continued. The innovation, Bambang continued, was developed by the National Nuclear Energy Agency (Batan). "Yesterday I was given fruit from Batan. I thought ordinary fruit. It turns out they showed fruits that had been cleaned of all bacteria including fruit flies. so that the fruit can be ready for export, "he explained. He said the use of nuclear for food could make the quality of the product even better, so that the product could be ready for export by Indonesia." So with a nuclear approach he could clean all bacteria. And why is that important? for exports, "he added.
